Text.Value: I didn't come here to fight gods - I just want to get rid of the mind flayer parasites.
I know one of them. Enver Gortash.
The crown it wears controls it, and these stones control the crown. It has been dominated.
The crown it wears controls it, and these stones control the crown. It has been dominated.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player] hold the nether stone in their hand.
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Magical hum as camera closes in on nether stone
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Magical glow and particles gently emanating from the stone

Text.Value: I'm familiar. An arms dealer and a slaver. Worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny. It sounds as though you've faced his tyranny yourself.
I'm familiar. An arms dealer and a slaver. Worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny. It sounds as though you've faced his tyranny yourself.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reuse shot form vision of Dead 3 scene, but the light shifts in away revealing the figures scene in the Act 1 vision were indeed the three gathered in front of the brain.

Text.Value: The crown's markings suggest it was forged in Netheril, an ancient empire whose mastery over magic rivalled that of the gods.
The crown's markings suggest it was forged in Netheril, an ancient empire whose mastery over magic rivalled that of the gods.

EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Magical hum as camera closes in on nether stone
EditorData.VFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Magical glow and particles gently emanating from the stone

Text.Value: I know Lord Enver Gortash - an arms dealer and a slaver. He is a worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny.
I know Lord Enver Gortash - an arms dealer and a slaver. He is a worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reuse shot form vision of Dead 3 scene, but the light shifts in away revealing the figures scene in the Act 1 vision were indeed the three gathered in front of the brain.

Text.Value: What do we do now?
The crown atop the elder brain. Its markings suggest it was forged in Netheril, an ancient empire whose mastery over magic rivalled that of the gods.
The crown atop the elder brain. Its markings suggest it was forged in Netheril, an ancient empire whose mastery over magic rivalled that of the gods.

EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Magical hum as camera closes in on nether stone

Text.Value: Since Ketheric is the Chosen of Myrkul, that means... the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are Chosen of the Dead Three.
Since Ketheric is the Chosen of Myrkul, that means... the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are Chosen of the Dead Three.

EditorData.NodeContext: putting the pieces together as they speak

Text.Value: But working together, and with those stones and that crown...
But working together, and with those stones and that crown...

EditorData.NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders with the means to trigger nuclear war

Text.Value: You did well. Really well.
You did well. Really well.
What hope do we have if the gods themselves are involved?
And now the picture comes together.
And now the picture comes together.
It is a crown of domination. The stones were taken from its crest. They are Netherstones, imbued with the ability to control the wearer of the crown.
It is a crown of domination. The stones were taken from its crest. They are Netherstones, imbued with the ability to control the wearer of the crown.
A temporary reprieve, but a welcome one. With the brain on its way to the city, its influence here is weakened.
A temporary reprieve, but a welcome one. With the brain on its way to the city, its influence here is weakened.
Perhaps not a cure, but you've found the source of your infection. And the reason for its abnormality.
Perhaps not a cure, but you've found the source of your infection. And the reason for its abnormality.

EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Magical hum as camera closes in on nether stone

Text.Value: The crown's Netherese magic must be the true source of the parasites' abilities. This must be what elevates their potential.
The crown's Netherese magic must be the true source of the parasites' abilities. This must be what elevates their potential.

EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Magical hum as camera closes in on nether stone

Text.Value: Netherese power like nothing anyone's seen in ages. They say magic led to the destruction of Netheril itself...
Within the city, an elder brain brimming with power, ready to turn everyone within its reach into mind flayers. All it needs is an order.
Within the city, an elder brain brimming with power, ready to turn everyone within its reach into mind flayers. All it needs is an order.
But working together, and controlling an elder brain...
But working together, and controlling an elder brain...

EditorData.NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders sharing a nuclear bomb

Text.Value: I dare not imagine what they might achieve.
I dare not imagine what they might achieve.

EditorData.NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders with the means to trigger nuclear war

Text.Value: How is it you're able to leave the Astral Prism now?
The Absolute is neither god nor man. It is the elder brain you saw, held here by those three against its will.
The Absolute is neither god nor man. It is the elder brain you saw, held here by those three against its will.
So it is accomplished. The first step.
So it is accomplished. The first step.
What are these stones?
I will be your shield, but you must be the sword.
I will be your shield, but you must be the sword.
Are you so blind to what's at stake?
Are you so blind to what's at stake?
We must wrest control of the brain from the Chosen before that happens - we must take their stones.
We must wrest control of the brain from the Chosen before that happens - we must take their stones.
Bane, Bhaal, and Myrkul. The tyrant, the assassin, and the necromancer.
Bane, Bhaal, and Myrkul. The tyrant, the assassin, and the necromancer.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: If possible, show the mural of the Dead Three from END_GodsAndMonsters_WithersMeeting.

Text.Value: Hope is a luxury for those who have a choice.
Hope is a luxury for those who have a choice.
Ketheric transformed during the fight - what was that?
The army of the Absolute is marching on Baldur's Gate.
The army of the Absolute is marching on Baldur's Gate.
Ketheric was a follower of Myrkul. Which means the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are the Chosen of the Dead Three.
Ketheric was a follower of Myrkul. Which means the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are the Chosen of the Dead Three.

EditorData.NodeContext: putting together the pieces as they speak

Text.Value: And when the chance to strike comes, you must take it. For there may only be one chance.
And when the chance comes to strike, you must take it. For there may only be one chance.
I believe you fought and defeated an avatar of Myrkul, the god of necromancy. A remarkable feat.
I believe you fought and defeated an avatar of Myrkul, the god of necromancy. A remarkable feat.
Which means the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are Chosen of the Dead Three.
Which means the Absolute is a front for the gods of death and our enemies are Chosen of the Dead Three.
One of them I know. Lord Enver Gortash - an arms dealer and a slaver. A worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny.
One of them I know. Lord Enver Gortash - an arms dealer and a slaver. A worshipper of Bane, the god of tyranny.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reuse shot form vision of Dead 3 scene, but the light shifts in away revealing the figures scene in the Act 1 vision were indeed the three gathered in front of the brain.

Text.Value: The other is a mystery to me. But the way she spoke, it is most likely she follows Bhaal - god of murder.
The other is a mystery to me. But the way she spoke, it is most likely she follows Bhaal - god of murder.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orin. Close-up of signs of Bhaal on Orin.
EditorData.NodeContext: walk few steps forwads while looking at Orin who stand infront of you, please get video from Greg for character positions as ref. [Choices]

Text.Value: Do you know who our enemies are?
I know. But the path to one lies through the other.
I know. But the path to one lies through the other.
Ketheric was Myrkul's Chosen.
Ketheric was Myrkul's Chosen.
Chosen of the Dead Three?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player] holds up stone. [Daisy] steps out from the portal thats open behinds players back. She gesture her right hand to close the portal as she walks toward the player.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player holds up stone. A portal opens up behind it (same one we used in Astral Prison to travel back to material plane.) Daisy steps out (in cine only.)
EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Sounds of a magical portal opening and closing

Text.Value: Netherese? These Chosen are powerful indeed to have such magic in their command.
I didn't come here to fight gods - I just want my parasite removed.
We prepare for the fight of our lives, and the lives of everyone in Faerûn.
We prepare for the fight of our lives, and the lives of everyone in Faerûn.
And it must be the reason nobody could heal you.
And it must be the reason nobody could heal you.

EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Magical hum as camera closes in on nether stone

Text.Value: Each one alone would be a formidable enemy.
Each one alone would be a formidable enemy.

EditorData.NodeContext: with real worry - it's like 3 world leaders sharing a nuclear bomb

Text.Value: What can you tell me about the Crown the brain was wearing?
To master an elder brain... to subdue it... Our enemies are formidable.
To master an elder brain... to subdue it... Our enemies are formidable.
Remarkable. Truly.
Remarkable. Truly.
An order the death gods' Chosen are on the cusp of giving.
An order the death gods' Chosen are on the cusp of giving.
Whoever controls the crown could reshape the world... if they can control it.
*In death, the body is cooling, but energy radiates from the stone.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices][Player] approach and crouches next to Ketheric's body. He push the corpse over and take out his dagger to wrestles the stone out of the armour and lifts it into view.,

EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Sounds of a blade scraping against metal. Then a slight clink as the nether stone is released.

Text.Value: They are known to pick from their most devout followers a Chosen, granting them incredible powers.
They are known to pick from their most devout followers a Chosen, granting them incredible powers.
I came here looking for a cure - I still haven't found one.
I know. But this is the only way.
I know. But this is the only way.
If the crown can do this to the parasites, I dare not imagine what it is doing to the brain.
If the crown can do this to the parasites, I dare not imagine what it is doing to the brain.

EditorData.SFXTags: [AMN][GUS-215968] Magical hum as camera closes in on nether stone

Text.Value: This is the battle of our lives, and the lives of everyone in Faerûn.
This is the battle of our lives, and the lives of everyone in Faerûn.
Our chances of success are slim, but we must not fail. If we fail, everything ends.
Our chances of success are slim, but we must not fail. If we fail, everything ends.

Synopsis: This dialog plays after picking up the Crown Controller ring off Ketheric’s body. The player will realize that they need to collect the other two Crown Controllers from Orin and Gortash before they can use them to command the Elder Brain. Picking up the Crown Controller allows the party to continue onward to the epilogue/intermezzo of Act 2.
